p: More specifically, the labelling profiles shown in Figures S1 and S2 indicated that a pulse period below five hours did not lead to significant 13C enrichments in both camphor and 1,8-cineol. However, 13CO 2 pulses of five hours and more resulted in 13C-enrichments of >2% ( Figure 3A,B). Some of the samples showed 13C enrichments of more than 10% (up to 25% in some cineole and camphor samples ( Figure 3). Even experiments with a given pulse period (i.e., the said 5 h) showed considerable differences of labelling profiles that can be explained, in part, on the basis of different chase periods. Generally, it appeared that the 13C enrichments increase with higher chase periods ( Figures S1 and S2).
